Description: Serekh as inlay: Inlay in the form of the serekh-façade topped by a seated falcon facing right wearing the double plumes. Moulded with the reverse flat and the obverse in relief. The serekh is of opaque pale-blue glass, the falcon of opaque pale turquoise-blue glass. The upper half of the serekh above the palace-façade panelling carries not a name but a thin diagonal band running from the top right-hand corner to the bottom left.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: C. Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (London 1994): fig.66.
